questions.question: The State of Design is to ensure that a continuing structural integrity programme, including information concerning corrosion control, is maintained in respect of aeroplanes:
options: a. with maximum certificated take-off mass less than 5700 kg
b. with maximum certificated take-off mass greater than 5700 kg
c. with maximum certificated take-off mass equal to 5700 kg
d. with maximum certificated take-off mass not more than 5700 kg

questions.question: The continuing validity of a Certificate of Airworthiness of an aircraft is subject to the laws of:
options: b. the State of Registration or the State of the Operator
c. the State of the Operator
d. the State of Registration and the State of Design

questions.question: When a Contracting State first enters on its register an aircraft and issues or validates a Certificate of Airworthiness, it shall inform:
options: d. The State of the Operator

questions.question: Which document contains information concerning the flight limitations of the aircraft ?
